conclusion: Analyze the image to understand the path of the laser beam and the geometry of the semi-cylindrical transparent brick.

The image shows a semi-cylindrical transparent brick with endpoints A and C on the cross-sectional diameter. A laser beam travels from point A to point C along the arc surface ABC. The brick has a radius r and a refractive index n. The laser beam moves at a speed V along the AC direction.
The laser beam starts at point A and travels along the arc surface ABC to point C.
The arc ABC is part of a circle with radius r.
The length of the arc ABC can be calculated using the formula for the arc length of a circle: Arc length = (θ/360) × 2πr.
θ = 90° because the arc spans from A to C, which are endpoints of the diameter.
The time taken for the laser beam to travel this arc length is given by t = (Arc length)/Speed = πr/(2V).
The refractive index n affects the speed of light inside the transparent brick, but since the question specifies ignoring the propagation time of light, we use the speed V outside the brick.
The time taken for the laser beam to travel from A to C is πr/(2V).
